page.title: 01The Landscape
page.content: Most of the fields in our area are full of cows, mainly Friesians because most of the farms are dairy farms. There are also a number of crops growing in the area,which include rape seed,wheat,corn,and barley.Some of the fields are kept to grow grass which later will be turned into hay or sileage it would then be stored and fed to cattle when needed. For an example of the crops grown in the area I visited Greenhill Farm. I asked the farmer a few qestions on the percentages of things grown or kept on his land.20% of the crop was silage,20% was barley,40% was wheat, and 20% was for sheep and beef cattle. The farmer owned 150 acres.This farm had no dairy cattle which surprised me. Most of the fields are seperated by barbed wire,hedges,and electric fences
